intro: Hevea microphylla var. major, commonly known as the giant rubber vine, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and can grow up to 30 meters in height. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by elongated, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is valued for its latex-producing properties. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is often cultivated in humid, tropical environments.
